sub_title: Head of Decision Strategy and Statistical Analysis at Western Hub at Santander Consumer Finance Europe
summary: Over 14 years' of risk management experience in the banking and advisory industries, with emphasis on improving efficiency, productivity and providing skilful support to Management Board. Successful in risk project management with a broad range of risk expertise. Well organized and independent. Focused and determined to achieve the goals and objectives. Able to effectively coordinate tasks to accomplish projects with timeliness and creativity. Stay calm under pressure. Strong analytical skills with a keen eye for details. Skilled at synthesizing and editing information to achieve overall objectives. High-energy, openminded, confident professional with an infectious enthusiasm for technology, automation and innovation. Taking care of strength interpersonal relations. Being able to build and manage a successful team based on communication, competencies, engagement and responsibility, creativity and rational way of thinking.

education.degree_name: Certificate of doctoral studies completion in Economics

education.field_of_study: Faculty of Electronics and Information Technology

profile_positions.description: • leading risk system environments, decision strategies and statistical analysis for retail business at Western Hub
profile_positions.title: Head of Decision Strategy and Statistical Analysis at Western Hub

profile_positions.description:
• managing retail, self-employed and SME type of customers
• managing direct cash loan, durable FTL loan, revolving and automotive (including stock finance) portfolio built by online and classic acquisition processes
• managing the strategic credit risk elements: strategic commercial plan, risk budgeting and forecasting, cost of risk (LLP), risk appetite, risk limits
• responsible for risk admission strategies (scores, credit risk policy rules, underwriting processes)
• operating Modellica and Experian risk decision systems, supporting changes in Ficres and AS400
• leading both implementation of affordability calculation based on the new regulatory norms in the Netherlands, and development of affordability logic for Belgium
• leading implementation of online scoring system (modelling, strategy, JOST tool) for direct loans acquisition process in The Netherlands which boost revenue 24MM over the previous level, while decreasing risk by one third 
• co-leading together with L&C department implementation of Locked up policy on revolving portfolio successfully approved by Dutch regulator
• leading decision engine migration for BeNeLux portfolio from both technical and business strategies perspective 
• leading the implementation of counteroffer functionality
• piloting EAD, LGD, PD, outstanding runoff, prepayment & redemption models redevelopment based on New Default requirements set by EBA
• automating internal as well as external reporting: HQ, AFM, Finance, Sales, Risk (scoring, underwriting)
• overseeing risk documentation governance; policies, procedures, committees
• co-initiator and co-designer of fully digital and automatic onboarding process in The Netherlands
• building bridges between commercial (sales & marketing) and risk activities 
• the Santander group´s global Digital Transformation Award 2021 for Just Online Scoring Tool (JOST) implementation and achieved results
• very close and fruitful cooperation with CRO
• team management
profile_positions.title: Director, Credit Risk Manager

profile_positions.description:
• managing credit risk controlling
• defining and maintaining of Risk IT environments: development, testing and production analytical and SQL servers
• managing IFRS9 project, responsible for internal development, testing, implementation, governance and monitoring of provision engine as well as risk models under IFRS9 approach
• automating IAS39 provision calculation process (local Dutch GAAP approach); reducing time processing from over 8h to less than 20min
• implementing outstanding reconciliation between risk (contract level) and finance/accounting (GL level) sources 
• leading SAS9.4 migration and tool maintenance (admin role)
• developing and implementing admission scoring models for auto business customers (legal and non-legal entities) and optimizing cutoff policy causing significant improvement on this sub-portfolio 
• creating and maintaining in-house the tool which monitors risk batch processes created in SAS, Python, SQL
• building automated tool for effective risk data aggregation (RDA) and risk reporting
• very close and outstanding cooperation with CRO
• member of Management Team, the most significant managers in the company
• chosen one of the best employees in 2018, many times underlined managing the risk on outstanding level 
• team management
profile_positions.title: Senior Risk Manager

profile_positions.description:
• leading of PD models development of IRB implementation in the one of top 10 banks in Poland
• cooperating on IFRS9 methodology concept of the credit risk parameters PD, LGD EAD in the life time horizon in the one of top 3 banks in Austria. One of the originator of using Cox survival models for PD lifetime estimation
• one of the leaders of workshops in the business concept outlines for implementation of the IFRS9 accounting standard in the one of top 3 banks in Austria
• responsible for PD life time models development in one of top 3 banks in Austria. Together, 19 models were built based on vintage, Cox survival and Markov chain approaches dedicated for 4 countries and 5 different client portfolios: retail, micro, corporate, sovereign and municipalities
• responsible for validation of credit cards CCAR loss forecasting model for the one of top 3 banks in USA. Validation was prepared according to: model risk management policies, policy supplements, procedures, standards and regulatory guidance
• responsible for the PD rating models qualitative validation and methodology designer, leading of PwC Estonia in the quantity validation in the one of Estonian Bank of following PD rating models: Corporate Financing Rating Model, Commercial Real Estate Financing Rating Model, Property Development Financing Rating Model
• responsible for IRB impact study calculation for corporate and retail portfolio for the one of top 5 banks in Poland
• offers preparing for the financial institution covering: IRB and IFRS9 methodology and models (PD, EAD, LGD), risk and marketing models (risk conditional, pricing, propensity, churn) for the business usage i.e. x-sell, preaccepted process
• cooperating with the other PwC headquarters in the world i.e. PwC US, PwC Hong Kong, PwC Austria
• team management
profile_positions.title: Senior Associate

profile_positions.description:
•	responsible for the Credit Scoring System (Risk-Engine). 
•	managing of the Scoring System Implementation and Integration with the New Front-End System in cooperation with IT Department and External Software Supplier StatConsulting S.A.
•	defining detailed requirements for the Credit Scoring System.
•	programming and implementing into the Scoring System the Risk Strategies (scores, policy rules, manual verification rules). responsible for the BIK Cache application.
•	managing of the new version of BIK 3.7 (Credit Information Bureau) Implementation and Integration with the Credit Scoring System (Risk-Engine) in cooperation with IT Department and Credit Information Bureau in Poland. 
•	defining detailed requirements for the BIK Cache application.
•	creating whole automatic process to feed the Credit Scoring System database from different sources like V+, data warehouse, fraud database and Polish Bank Association databases.
•	creating automatic process for managing the Risk Strategy in the Credit Scoring System on customer and/or branch level.
•	defining detailed requirements and developed the tool in SAS software for the cross sell which boosted the production of cash loans.
•	responsible for development, implementation & monitoring of risk models for the retail risk area.
•	creating and developing application and behavioral score card and probability of default models, based on internal data and data from Credit Information Bureau (BIK) in SAS Institute software basis on statistics method and data mining using statistical modeling techniques such as logistic regression, tree decisions, time series and stochastic processes.
•	cooperating  with the headquarter in France in retail part of risk area.
•	participating in Business Leaders Team, the most significant managers in the company.
•	team management (4 people)
profile_positions.title: Head of the Risk Processes and Segmentation Office

profile_positions.description:
•	creating CRM relational database based on data from BIK reports gathered in the whole history in the Bank. 
•	building the behavioral model and probability of default model.
•	creating a credit risk estimation and development of repeat business process.
•	calculating the expected loss estimation based on BIK data. 
•	developing the anti-money laundering analyses.
•	developing the marketing analyses and clients segmentations.
•	developing the marketing loyalty services for pharmacy sector in Poland.
profile_positions.title: Scoring and Modeling Expert

company.name: Kredyt Bank S.A. (part of KBC group)

profile_positions.company: Kredyt Bank S.A. (part of KBC group)
profile_positions.description:
•	responsible for development, implementation and monitoring of risk models for the retail risk area.
•	responsible for the implementation of the Group Programme – Basel II Credit Risk for the retail area.
•	preparing application file for Internal Ratings Based “Foundation” Approach for retail part of bank.
•	creating application and behavioural score cards models, application and behavioural probability of default pooling models, loss given default models and exposure at default models in SAS Institute software basis on statistics method and data mining for: retail customers (– mortgage loans, – cash loans, – overdrafts, – credit cards) and small and medium enterprises with single accounting (– investments loans, cash loans, working capital loans, – overdrafts).

•	developing models methodology especially related to scores and PD risk models.
•	implementing the AMRON Polish Bank Association real estate database
•	creation and developing of model for revaluation of real estate value.
•	cooperating with the headquarter in Belgium in retail part of risk area.
•	cooperating with the PriceWaterhauseCoopers company in the score models validation process.
•	cooperating with the Ernst&Yung company during development of the loss given default models.
•	team management (4 people)
profile_positions.title: Head of the Scoring and Modeling Office

skills: Credit Risk Decision Strategies and Processes
